conclusion: Understand the process from C to A as isothermal with temperature 200K.
At state C: Volume \( V_C = 5 \) L, Pressure \( P_C = 1 \times 10^5 \) Pa; At state A: Volume \( V_A = 2 \) L, Pressure \( P_A = 1 \times 10^5 \) Pa.
Use the ideal gas law \( PV = nRT \) and the relationship \( P_C V_C = P_A V_A \) for constant temperature.
For an isothermal process, work done \( W = nRT \ln \left( \frac{V_A}{V_C} \right) \) or \( W = P \Delta V \).
Given \( T = 200 \) K, \( V_C = 5 \) L, \( V_A = 2 \) L, calculate work done from C to A.
Calculate \( W = P_A \Delta V \) with \( P_A = 1 \times 10^5 \) Pa and \( \Delta V = -3 \) L, resulting in \( W = -300 \, \text{J} \).
Interpret the negative sign as work done on the gas by the external environment.
Final answer: The work done by the external environment on the gas during the process from C to A is \( 300 \) J.
